end.title: Hugo
end.creator_credit: Graham King, Johnny Depp, Martin Scorsese and Tim Headington
end.headline_credit: France, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2011
end.brief_description: Orphaned except for an uncle, Hugo Cabret lives in the walls of a train station in 1930s Paris. His job is to oil and maintain the station’s clocks, but he’s more interested in protecting a broken automaton and notebook left to him by his late father.

constellations_other.name: The Lumière brothers
constellations_other.description: The Lumière brothers understood the potential of cinema to be exhibited theatrically. Only one person could watch films through Thomas Edison's Kinetograph, while Auguste and Louis exhibited their films to thousands with Cinematographe.

end.title: King Kong
end.creator_credit: Ernest B. Schoedsack, Merian C. Cooper, Walter Daniels and Willis H. O'Brien
end.brief_description: Adventurous filmmaker, Carl Denham, sets out to produce a motion picture unlike anything the world has seen before. Alongside his leading lady Ann Darrow and his first mate Jack Driscoll, they arrive on an island and discover a legendary creature said to be neither beast nor man. Denham captures the monster to displayed on Broadway as Kong, the eighth wonder of the world.

constellations_other.description: Maps are designed to communicate complex information in a clear manner to aid both navigation and wayfinding and knowledge of place.

constellations_other.name: MoCaps and rotos
constellations_other.description: Though VFX continues to push boundaries and brings fantastical worlds and creatures to life, there's still a place for classic animation techniques.

links.description: Similar to each new Star Wars narrative, the numerous versions of King Kong have employed special and visual effects that build on a history of creation. The original movie is renowned for complex stop motion, in-camera effects and rear projection.

start.brief_description: Monkeyshines, No. 1 was shot by William K. L. Dickson and William Heise for the Edison labs. The series were filmed in the format of the Kinetoscope, and are believed to be the first films shot in the United States.

constellations_other.name: Found footage and the first camcorder
constellations_other.description: Amateur filmmakers turned the camera on their own lives when camcorders like the Sony Betamovie BMC-100P came on the market. The style of footage filmed on camcorders has inspired many fictional films, particularly in the horror genre.

constellations_other.name: One of the first auteurs
constellations_other.description: A progenitor of modern film genres such as sci-fi, psychological thriller and serial killer films decades before such terms were coined, Austrian-born director Fritz Lang also enjoyed the occasional on-screen meta-moment.

links.description: The automaton featured in Hugo was designed by celebrated props maker Dick George who began his design career working on Star Wars stormtrooper helmets at Shepperton Design Studios.

links.description: By breaking down movement into increments of time, Muybridge provided a new understanding of movement. His photographs formed a moving image sequence, an innovation that inspired the Edison Manufacturing Company’s Kinetoscope projector and their early experiments in film called Monkeyshines.
